entries.meaning: The state or characteristic of being indiscernible; inability to be observed.
(often philosophical) Inability to be perceived as distinct from something else; indistinguishability .
examples: Yet, from another perspective entirely, in both genres of analysis—those in which film is taken as medium of law and those in which law is taken as a medium of film—one necessarily acknowledges and approaches a zone of indiscernibility between the two.
